p: Erythritol secretion was highly favored by the increase of glycerol concentration in the media reaching 65.8 g/L (the highest reported value in this study) and Y Ery/Glol = 0.39 g/g (see Table 3 and Figure 4b) in the experiment with Glol 0~170 g/L. In terms of the cultures with Glol 0~120 g/L, Ery max concentration reached the value of 38.4 g/L (Y Ery/Glol = 0.39 g/g) and in cultures with the lowest initial crude glycerol concentration (Glol 0~70 g/L), Ery max concentration reached 14.9 g/L (Y Ery/Glol = 0.23 g/g) ( Table 3). These observations indicated a shift of the yeast metabolism from citric acid accumulation towards erythritol production. In the literature, it has been reported that polyols function as osmolytes stored inside microbial cells (by means of cell protection by osmotic stress), thus act as soluble compounds that maintain the cellâ€™s fluid balance and protein folding [ 23, 26, 46, 50]. Likewise, in the present study, the substantial enhancement of erythritol production ( Table 3), might be attributed to the exposure of the selected strain into higher glycerol concentrations.
